content.question: Which of the following is an accurate explanation of a limitation of the data in the graph?

choices.label: Specific information for each year is lost by averaging data for each time period.
The 2009-2015 period is labeled as a coalition government, but only the Conservatives were in power.
The annual average increase in government spending on health across all time periods is too high.
The BBC does not have access to all government spending on health, so the data are inaccurate.

content.answer: Specific information for each year is lost by averaging data for each time period.
